channel.title: The origin of screaming
channel.description:
I'm very interested in how screaming originated. I guess I'll start off by providing my definition of it. Screaming is an aggressive style of singing that typically integrates both chest voice and head voice (NOT falsetto, see [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zU-OlPet7lk]this[/url] for an explanation) sung typically by males. In contemporary rock, the standard vocal range is up to a C5 (one octave above middle C), which is the average upper range while using pure chest voice type vocals. In hard rock (and more notably hair metal), most vocal ranges extend past that (notable bands: AC/DC, Aerosmith, Bon Jovi, Cinderella, Deep Purple, Def Leppard, Guns n Roses, Led Zeppelin, Motley Crue, Slaughter, Stryper, Uriah Heep, Van Halen, and Whitesnake). The earliest example of screaming which I had found was the Beatles's Hey Jude, in which Paul hits an F5. If you have any songs with excellent screaming, post them here. :)
Bonus if you find a screaming song earlier than 'Hey Jude'.
P.S. If this belongs in the General Questions forum, I apologize. I wanted this to be more of a discussion rather than a question and answer topic.

item.title: The origin of screaming
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Frell:

What? When you try and go for max recording quality how do you endup sounding better live lol?

the energy of the show, the potential for for improvisation with in the live act, the potential for not having a decent producer/equipment to record the material, the differences in the live mix (where instruments are in the soundscape)… there’s a lot at play; why not check out the examples posted to see for yourself.

Read full topic

item.title: The origin of screaming
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

the elve age:

Uhh sppt, what bands sound better live?

Earthless is a pretty major example, they tend to take a few parts from the 20 minute songs on their albums as the skeleton, then jam around it.
You cannot beat that. I’ve actually seen em two days in a row at the same festival, and they were completely different sets, and both kicked ass.

Read full topic

item.title: The origin of screaming
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

t4:

I’ve never listened to an entire album from a7x front to back, but I’ve heard my share of them; I don’t see how that makes any difference. I don’t really like their style of music, I find their stage names to be laughable and they tend to be thought of as ‘metal’ (which they’re not).

Exactly, they aren’t metal. But ignorant people throw them into that genre and then the true metal heads get mad. And the stage names are laughable, they said in an interview they did it for fun and knew theyd take alot of heat for it. Most of them were nicknames in highschool though.

Read full topic

item.title: The origin of screaming
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:45, topic:451499”][quote author=Natey link=topic=554385.msg4066742#msg4066742 date=1343952907]

rofl @ a7x being good

[/quote]
People who don’t like avenged sevenfold also tend to not like metallica, guns n roses etc. The #1 reason for people not liking them is because theyre still categorized as “metal/metalcore” from back in 1999/2002 when they were an annoying screamo band[/quote]
Metallica has always been crap, even on Kill 'em All/Ride the Lightening/Master of Puppets. They just got worse since they went arena-rock.

edit: Guns n Roses isn’t a metal band? Or… metalcore for that matter…

edit2: a7x isn’t metal either?..

[quote=“Chassy13, post:46, topic:451499”][quote author=Natey link=topic=554385.msg4066742#msg4066742 date=1343952907]

rofl @ a7x being good

[/quote]

Rofl @ Castrato being good. Such generalization, have you even listened to a full A7X album?

People who don’t like avenged sevenfold also tend to not like metallica, guns n roses etc. The #1 reason for people not liking them is because theyre still categorized as “metal/metalcore” from back in 1999/2002 when they were an annoying screamo band

Yep. If I am to mention that I like Avenged Sevenfold at school, people categorize it as screamo completely. They are far from screamo, and albums like City of Evil are amazing. Their live performances sound exactly like they do on the CD.

Unfortunately I never got to see a show with Jimmy in it, but he did have an extraordinary voice.

Frell, thank you for negatively posting that BFMV video on the first page. I cannot stand that fucking band.[/quote]
I’ve never listened to an entire album from a7x front to back, but I’ve heard my share of them; I don’t see how that makes any difference. I don’t really like their style of music, I find their stage names to be laughable and they tend to be thought of as ‘metal’ (which they’re not).

Read full topic

item.description:

People who don’t like avenged sevenfold also tend to not like metallica, guns n roses etc. The #1 reason for people not liking them is because theyre still categorized as “metal/metalcore” from back in 1999/2002 when they were an annoying screamo band
[/quote]

Yep. If I am to mention that I like Avenged Sevenfold at school, people categorize it as screamo completely. They are far from screamo, and albums like City of Evil are amazing. Their live performances sound exactly like they do on the CD.[/quote]
Generally bands who sound exactly the same live are pretty bad, I like bands that actually sound better live.

@Frell, if you’re looking for a band that spans a wide number of genres, look up Ween, their music pretty much ranges from country rock, hard rock, punk rock, progressive rock, psychedelic rock, heavy metal and speed metal, to country pop, country folk, honky tonk, flamenco, funk, pop, psychedelic pop to soul.

item.title: The origin of screaming
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Songs to check out if you ever want to take your head out of your ass:

Victim (True A7X)
Nightmare (True A7X/rock)
Buried alive (True A7X)
A little piece of heaven (Funny/Halloween)
Natural born killer (Rock)
So Far Away (True A7X)
Welcome to the family (Rock)
Critical acclaim (Rock) and fucking insane chorus by jimmy
Fiction (True A7X) the drummer wrote this song 3 days before he died

And then they have a few older good ones that are a bit nasally when he was less experienced

Dear god
Gunslinger (Jarhead music video makes the song IMO)
I wont see you tonight pt 1 (get through the beginning and youll love the rest)

And then the two when he was about 18-19 lol

Warmness on the soul (I can play this on piano)
To end the rapture

Obviously they aren’t the only band I like. I still listen to Queen, Aerosmith, Guns n Roses, Led Zeppelin etc. Avenged sevenfold just has so many songs that sound so different that they can cover a wide span of genres.

Read full topic
